channel.title: New Go version 1.11
channel.description:
Go just released a new version with few really interesting features that we might use for MESG. :tada: https://golang.org/doc/go1.11
### [WASM support](https://golang.org/doc/go1.11?ref=hvper.com#wasm) This is something to test but we might be able to embed the core directly in a browser. That would be interesting and opens a lot of possibilities
### [Modules and versioning](https://golang.org/doc/go1.11?ref=hvper.com#modules) No more GOPATH and no more endless discussion about versioning. There is now an official support for versions.
What do you think about all this ? Do you think we need to look at it for MESG ?

item.title: New Go version 1.11
item.dc:creator: Nicolas
item.description:
Core use go 1.11 since this PR:

github.com/mesg-foundation/core

Switch to go1.11

by krhubert on 05:07PM - 01 Dec 18 UTC
4 commits changed 144 files with 519 additions and 111292 deletions.

Read full topic

item.title: New Go version 1.11
item.dc:creator: krhubert
item.description:
About WASM it would be really nice thing, but too much effort and in return too low value. It also opens new surface for attacker + unprevilage mesg installation on users browsers.

About versioning of course we should take a look at this one.

Read full topic

item.title: New Go version 1.11
item.dc:creator: Anthony
item.description:
Go just released a new version with few really interesting features that we might use for MESG.
https://golang.org/doc/go1.11

WASM support

This is something to test but we might be able to embed the core directly in a browser. That would be interesting and opens a lot of possibilities

Modules and versioning

No more GOPATH and no more endless discussion about versioning. There is now an official support for versions.

What do you think about all this ? Do you think we need to look at it for MESG ?
